alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 9:14PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado through 945 PM MDT... At 914 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles north of Boyero, or 23 miles southwest of Flagler, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado, including the following locations... Wild Horse and Aroya. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for east central Colorado.
